title: U.S. biathlete’s reaction to winning country’s first world championship gold will have you in tears | For The Win
text:
By: Charles Curtis | February 16, 2017 1:43 pm Follow @bycharlescurtis 
A big, huge, monumental thing happened in the world of the biathlon on Thursday: Lowell Bailey finished the 20-kilometer individual competition with a world championship, the first first American ever to win gold 
His reaction upon winning was incredible, a combination of pure elation and shock that might leave you in tears: 
— IBU World Champs (@IBU_WC) February 16, 2017 
What’s even crazier is that the 35-year-old Bailey nearly retired last year because his wife was expecting. From the Associated Press : 
“I am glad I didn’t stop,” said Bailey, 35, who thanked his wife for enabling him to continue. “She supported me in that decision. 
“We had our daughter, Ophelia, this summer, which made things much more interesting as a family. So we had to be creative in how I train and what I did this year. But it all worked out and I am so thankful for them, and everyone who has helped me so far.” 
Now, we’ll see Bailey in his fourth Olympics in 2018. More Olympics!
